etymologies: late 19th century. From the name of J. Grier Ralston, amateur mineralogist, who discovered the mineral + -ite

definitions: A fluoride mineral which occurs as colourless or white, transparent to translucent crystals, chiefly as an alteration product of cryolite.

notes.text: Ralstonite is a hydrated fluoride and hydroxide of sodium, magnesium, and aluminium, NaMgAl(F,OH)₆·H₂O. Crystal system: cubic.
